choices.E: You can create a cluster by using WLST, the WebLogic Server Administration Console, or Enterprise Manager Fusion Middleware Control.
choices.B: The server instances in a cluster must all run on the same machine.
choices.D: Server instances in a cluster can run different versions of WebLogic Server.
choices.A: A cluster appears to clients as multiple WebLogic Server instances.
choices.F: For management purposes, you can split a cluster across multiple domains.
choices.C: You can scale a cluster by adding machines to the cluster to host additional server instances.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are correct about cluster support for Oracle SOA Suite 12c applications?

discussion.content:
C. You can scale a cluster by adding machines to the cluster to host additional server instances.
E. You can create a cluster by using WLST, the WebLogic Server Administration Console, or Enterprise Manager Fusion Middleware Control. 

http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E12839_01/web.1111/e13709/overview.htm#CLUST115
http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E12839_01/web.1111/e13709/config.htm#CLUST170

Selected Answer: A
I've used Configuration Plans for my SOA composites. They're great!

questions.question_text:
As an Oracle SOA Suite composite moves through the software development life cycle, certain environment-specific changes must be made to the composite configuration from deployment to deployment.
Which feature can help you capture and effect these changes?
Which two statements accurately describe policy attachment in Oracle Web Services Manager (OWSM)?

choices.C: Multiple WS-Addressing policies can be attached to a policy subject.
choices.A: The order in which policies are attached to a subject determines the order in which the policies are executed.
choices.D: In Enterprise Manager Fusion Middleware Control, a security policy can be attached to a web service and it can be either enabled or disabled.
choices.B: JDeveloper groups the policies that can be attached into five categories of interceptors.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In the link below It Says : The order in which policies are attached to a subject or appear in the list of attached polices does not determine the order in which policies are executed. So A should also be incorrect! 
 https://docs.oracle.com/middleware/1212/owsm/OWSMS/attach-owsm-policy.htm

comments.content: There are five types of interceptors (reliable messaging, management, WS-Addressing, security, and MTOM) that together form a policy interceptor chain.

discussion.content:
A. The order in which policies are attached to a subject determines the order in which the policies are executed.
D. In Enterprise Manager Fusion Middleware Control, a security policy can be attached to a web service and it can be either enabled or disabled.

https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E23943_01/web.1111/b32511/intro_security.htm#WSSEC1112
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E21764_01/web.1111/b32511/attaching.htm#WSSEC1184
http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E28280_01/web.1111/b32511/attaching.htm#WSSEC4210

A. They enable the monitoring and publishing of incoming and outgoing messages.
B. XPath expressions can be used as a filter to track a particular type of message
D. The output of a composite sensor can be directed to Oracle Business Activity Monitoring

choices.B: XPath expressions can be used as a filter to track a particular type of message.
choices.E: They publish their output to the WebLogic Administration Console.
choices.A: They enable the monitoring and publishing of incoming and outgoing messages.
choices.D: The output of a composite sensor can be directed to Oracle Business Activity Monitoring.
choices.C: You can choose to view the runtime output of the composite sensor in a database table.

questions.question_text: Identify three true statements about the use of composite sensors.
Which statement accurately describes how to use SOA Suite to create a REST interface for a provider application that does not support REST?

choices.B: Use Oracle Service Bus or BPEL Process Manager and utilize the REST binding that is available for both. The REST binding will automatically translate a REST payload from JSON or XML to SOAP/XML for processing in the middleware layer.
choices.C: Use a BPEL process with a REST binding and utilize the nXSD activity to translate the native JSON payload to XML for processing.
choices.A: Oracle Service Bus must be used. An HTTP proxy service is created and a pipeline is added with a conditional branch for each HTTP verb that the interface will serve. If there is any non-XML payload, such as JSON, an external parser service must be used to translate it to XML.
choices.D: Use the HTTP transport in Oracle Service Bus for the REST interaction and use nXSD to translate the JSON payload to XML for processing.

discussion.content: C. Use a BPEL process with a REST binding and utilize the nXSD activity to translate the native JSON payload to XML for processing.
